Yes, there are several projects and organizations that are involved in climate change adaptation efforts in São Tomé and Príncipe. Some of these include:

1. The Global Environment Facility (GEF): The GEF is providing funding for several projects aimed at helping São Tomé and Príncipe adapt to climate change. These projects include improving water management, protecting marine biodiversity, and promoting sustainable agriculture.

2. The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP): The UNDP has been working with São Tomé and Príncipe to develop a National Adaptation Plan (NAP) to guide the country's response to climate change. The UNDP has also been supporting efforts to improve water management, promote renewable energy, and build resilience among vulnerable communities.

3. The African Development Bank (AfDB): The AfDB has funded several projects in São Tomé and Príncipe aimed at helping the country adapt to climate change. These projects include improving water supply and sanitation, promoting sustainable agriculture, and protecting coastal areas.

4. Local NGOs: Several local NGOs are also involved in climate change adaptation efforts in São Tomé and Príncipe. For example, the NGO HBD is working to promote sustainable land management practices and support community-based conservation efforts.

Overall, there are many organizations and initiatives aimed at helping São Tomé and Príncipe adapt to the impacts of climate change.
